channel.title: 1 error -.-
channel.description:
Hello, Im trying to add ipban command to my server, but 1 error when im compiling :( Can someone tell me what problem?
[code]:: Preparing for compile... :: Auto-setting envriomental variables... :: :: Scanning for latest JDK version... :: :: Found JDK 1.6.0_05 :: Results: client.java:11087: cannot find symbol symbol : method appendToBannedIps(java.lang.String) location: class client appendToBannedIps(v.connectedFrom); ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error :: Done! Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

item.title: 1 error -.-
item.dc:creator: @Evanz Evanz
item.description:
@Evanz wrote:

[quote="_Vengeance, post:5, topic:192804"]vic 08: You are an idiot.
Justelis: You are even worse.[/quote]

Agreed.

[quote=“Justelis, post:7, topic:192804”]I did something but 4 errors… What’s wrong now?

:: Preparing for compile... :: Auto-setting envriomental variables... :: :: Scanning for latest JDK version... :: :: Found JDK 1.6.0_05 :: Results: client.java:11109: illegal start of expression public void appendToBannedIps (String player) { ^ client.java:11109: illegal start of expression public void appendToBannedIps (String player) { ^ client.java:11109: ';' expected public void appendToBannedIps (String player) { ^ client.java:11109: ';' expected public void appendToBannedIps (String player) { ^ 4 errors :: Done! Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]
Try adding or removing a } or a { before line 11109

Read full topic

item.title: 1 error -.-
item.dc:creator: @Abcscape Abcscape
item.description:
@Abcscape wrote:

You should have already declared it if you had the command. You need to make a void that gives the victim permission to use that void. Then in that void it will contain messages sent and codes to send information to the banned usernames.

Read full topic

item.title: 1 error -.-
item.dc:creator: @vic_08 Vic_
item.description:
@vic_08 wrote:

Like he said, you need to declare it…

If your ip ban doesnt work try this,

[code] }

    if (command.startsWith("ipban")
            && (playerRights >= 3 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Vic 08"))) {
        String victim = command.substring(6);
        int index = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(victim);
        client v = (client) server.playerHandler.players[index];

        appendToBannedIps(v.connectedFrom);
        v.disconnected = true;
        sendMessage("player successfully ip banned");
        PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName
                + ": HAS IP BANNED THE PLAYER: " + command.substring(5);
        BufferedWriter bw = null;

        try {
            bw = new BufferedWriter(
                    new FileWriter("logs/ipbanlogs.txt", true));
            bw.write(playerName + " banned" + victim);
            bw.newLine();
            bw.flush();
        } catch (IOException ioe) {
            ioe.printStackTrace();
        } finally {
            if (bw != null) {
                try {
                    bw.close();
                } catch (IOException ioe2) {
                    sendMessage("Error logging ip bans!");
                }
            }
        }[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: 1 error -.-

You haven’t declared what appendToBannedIPs means.
